intro: Edosmia montana, commonly known as the mountain edosmia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at high altitudes, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of hair, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Edosmia montana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
